music

Class Measure

  • java.lang.Object
    • music.Measure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChordSequence

    public class Measure
extends java.lang.Object
implements ChordSequence
    The class Measure represents a measure and all the music inside it, plus the key signature and accidentals associated with the measure. Measures are immutable.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<ChordSequence> chordSequences
      the List of ChordSequences (in this case Chords and Tuplets) that make up this measure.
      private KeySignature keySignature
      The key signature of the measure.
      private java.util.List<Syllable> syllables
      A list of the syllables of the measure, not associated with any Chords.

      Instantiates a new measure.
      Measure(java.util.List<ChordSequence> chordSequences)
      Instantiates a new measure without key signature or lyrics.

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • getChords

        public java.util.List<Chord> getChords()
        Recursively calls getChords() on each ChordSequence in the measure, applies the key signature and accidentals to the notes in the returned list, and strips the accidentals off the notes in that list. Also processes syllables and associates them with the correct Chords.
        Specified by:
        getChords in interface ChordSequence
        Returns:
        a list of the chords this measure contains, with accidentals applied and lyrics attached.
        See Also:
        ChordSequence.getChords()
